result.execSummary:
The defendant Bonnie M Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight time.  Sentence credit of 4 days were granted.
Court Deems TIME SERVED.
Court grants expunction upon written request of the defendant and upon successful completion of high school diploma/GED and no new criminal law violations.

Court cost waived.
DNA Surcharge waived.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Bonnie M Thomas in court with attorney Maura A. McMahon.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Sam Wegleitner, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 9.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following:
- 4 days jail.  Credit for 4 days.  COURT DEEMS TIME SERVED. 
- Court costs waived.
- DNA Surcharge waived.
- Court grants expunction upon written request of the defendant and upon successful completion of high school diploma/GED and no new criminal law violations.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 30, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Defendant appeared by video

Defendant Bonnie M Thomas, by video, with attorney Maura A. McMahon in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Lucas Bennewitz, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense would like to accept the State's offer.  Court will set this matter after defendant's expected release date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 30, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on July 18, 2014 at 09:00 am.
filed, to be produced from the Washington County Detention Facility. Judge Foster has denied this request, July 11, 2014.

Hearing on June 30, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing  Defendant to have no contact with alleged co defendants victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant to remain at address that was provided in Court, 211 Morris Street, Apt. #1, Pewaukee, WI. Defendant allowed non collect calls.   Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program. She shall report 1st business day upon release.

Defendant Bonnie M Thomas in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
